title.narrative: OUTPUT 4: EDUCATION URGENCES PREP & REPO

description.narrative: By 2016, the Haitian educational system and its actors have the means and technical capacities to reduce the vulnerability and the impact of emergency situations on children of preschool and basic education levels., which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, girls and boys aged 0-14 years in the three poorest quintiles benefit from education policies to ensure equitable access to quality basic education and opportunities for early childhood development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: of teachers who have been trained in the Disaster risk reduction with a gender perspective and support to people with a disability

actual.value: 2016:2400Explanation: Inspectors (400) and school directors (2000) have been trained in DRR in schools.

title.narrative: Existence of an effective coordination mechanism to prevent and respond to the needs of the education sector in emergency situations

actual.value: 2016:Yes. Although clusters have been discontinued, the emergency unit at the MoE is actively involved in the coordination of emergency activities.

title.narrative: Existence of a contingency plan at the national and departmental level, and updated each year.
